text: Trust (, ) is a 1976 Finnish-Soviet historical drama film directed by Edvin Laine and Viktor Tregubovich.Rollberg p.643 The film portrays the events leading up to the Finnish Declaration of Independence from Russia in 1917. ==Partial cast== * Kirill Lavrov as Lenin * Vladimir Tatosov as Sidney Reilly * Igor Dmitriev as Vladimir Bonch-Bruyevich * Margarita Terekhova as Aleksandra Kollontai * Antonina Shuranova as Rosa Luxemburg * Leonhard Merzin as Jukka Rahja * Anatoly Solonitsyn as Bochazhnikov * Leonid Nevedomsky as Mikhail Pokrovsky * Alexey Eybozhenko as Nikolai Krylenko * Oleg Yankovsky as Georgy Pyatakov * Vilho Siivola as Pehr Evind Svinhufvud * Yrjö Tähtelä as Carl Enckell * Yrjö Pavloff as Gustaf Idman * Esa Saario as Kullervo Manner * Innokenty Smoktunovsky as Nikolay Bobrikov * Matti Ranin as Eugen Wolff == References == == Bibliography == * Rollberg, Peter. Historical Dictionary of Russian and Soviet Cinema. Scarecrow Press, 2008. == External links == * Category:1976 films Category:1970s historical drama films Category:Soviet historical drama films Category:Finnish historical films Category:Soviet films Category:Finnish drama films Category:Finnish films Category:Russian-language films Category:Films directed by Edvin Laine Category:Films set in the 1910s Category:Works about Vladimir Lenin Category:Soviet multilingual films Category:Finnish multilingual films Category:1970s multilingual films Category:Films scored by Georgy Sviridov Category:1976 drama films
title: Trust (1976 film)
